Author: Vonem_PL#3212
Content: hi guys, Komodo will fork to algo Verushash? and anti ASIC?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: No

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
What is happening is that Komodo is allowing assetchains to choose what algorithm to implement. Komodo itself is continuing to use equihash. 
I understand why you ask this question, there was some ambiguity in the announcement made.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: @Vonem_PL

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: Intel filed a patent which seems to be for ASIC processors: http://patft.uspto.gov/netacgi/nph-Parser?Sect1=PTO2&Sect2=HITOFF&u=%2Fnetahtml%2FPTO%2Fsearch-adv.htm&r=1&p=1&f=G&l=50&d=PTXT&S1=10,142,098.PN.&OS=pn/10,142,098&RS=PN/10,142,098

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: Read to me more like an entire ASIC (even hardwiring 1/2 of what cgminer does) than just the processor

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: All of the "may"s in there read to me like intel wants to heve the only Bitcoin ASIC in the US

Author: B. Gültekin Çetiner#0626
Content: We were discussing with our main advisor @jl777c and other founding members about the mining of Marmara coin. It will use some Verus features in new Komodo fork. It will be a Verushash mineable coin with 50 % staking and 50 % of all blocks is planned to be timelocked between 3 months and 2 years. If decided, this 50%- timelock feature will be permanent policy. What would  a mining operator say about this? How would mining community and other users react to this? We are trying to find an optimum and just solution. Opinions?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: _is not a fan of mining out of pocket for `between 3 months and 2 years`_

Author: B. Gültekin Çetiner#0626
Content: @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢 thanks. Is it for miner, or pool operator or both?

Author: B. Gültekin Çetiner#0626
Content: And What percentage would be ok?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
both
Getting folks to join a pool is hard enough, but when you add "I can't pay you" to that, the coin itself has to have a unique draw like Verus itself does

Author: B. Gültekin Çetiner#0626
Content: @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢 What do you mean by unique draw?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
Verus is/was a totally unique thing that "everyone" wanted in on early
In order to sustain miners with timelocked rewards, you have to be unique enough to make them want to stop mining VRSC (or whatever else) and not get paid
While it's easier with CPU algo than GPU/ASIC, time and money are what they are

Author: B. Gültekin Çetiner#0626
Content: Marmara will also use Verushash and timelocked coins. Besides it will have 50% Verus staking. Those features are coming with new Komodo fork to Komodo.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: 50% staking sounds great until one realizes that they have to wait out the timelock before they can stake (which actually means it's 100% mining for the 1st 3 months or up to 2 years)

Author: jorian#4555
Content: if i remember correctly, VRSC didn't have timelocked blocks right from the start

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
yeah, that's what I mean, it's hard enough to get miners interested in a "new thing", but nearly impossible when they can do nothing with any of it for a time
(imo) locking from the start = only "rich" miners and "insiders" will do anything for quite a while

Author: jorian#4555
Content: what is the main reason for having timelocked blocks? why did VRSC do it?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: no sure I ever understood any reason for doing it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: to prevent early devs/miners/speculators from dumping on the market, I think was miket's motivation

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @B. Gültekin Çetiner timelocked blocks basically mean pools will not exist until time-locked blocks end

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: most miners dislike timelocked blocks, I would venture to say

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: If you're on a nomp, it can sometimes say that, I don't believe it would actually be assigning a negative value though. It's most likely assigning the positive value of whatever is shown

Author: mrlynch#5735
Content: oh... ok... everything seems fine though... must be the pool then front end then

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I've seen what you're talking about and the number shown (say -209000) is actually assigning 209000 as the difficulty.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: Not sure why it comes up as negative though

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
here The first KMD public pool to be Sapling ready will get a 100 KMD bounty from me and 1000 KMD bounty from jl777.
Requirements: You need sapling specific pool code and release the source for community.
The komodod binaries need to be compiled from **FSM** branch of https://github.com/PirateNetwork/komodo repo specifically. and the chain param is 
```
./komodod -ac_name=SPLTEST -ac_supply=5555555 -ac_reward=10000000000000 -ac_cc=2 -addressindex=1 -spentindex=1 -addnode=54.36.126.42 -addnode=94.130.224.11 &
```
